Review: i was in london and wanted to use one of the pure gyms in london so i went on the app to try to see if i was able to use that gym if i upgraded to a plus account. because i wasn‚Äôt upgraded to a plus account, it wouldn‚Äôt tell me if i could use that gym if i subscribed. all it was telling me was i could only use the gym i‚Äôm registered to. i don‚Äôt even understand why you can‚Äôt use some pure gyms if you‚Äôre a plus member. it defeats the purpose and makes it pointless. the gyms you can use are very limited. the whole point of it should be to allow you to use any pure gym you come across if you‚Äôre not near the one you‚Äôre registered to. i might be mistaken but i think that‚Äôs how it used to be, now they limit which gyms you can use making it not worth paying for.  anyway so i upgraded to a plus account and i tried to find the gym i wanted to use and found out it wasn‚Äôt on the list, so now they‚Äôre saying i‚Äôll be charged an extra ¬£6 on my next bill for the plus membership, even though i didn‚Äôt actually benefit from it. i won‚Äôt be paying it and i‚Äôm cancelling my membership.

Review: where do i start‚Ä¶. i have been a member of this gym for  a number of years now and i have seen a huge decline with how the gym is run and managed. the gym facilities, air conditioning, equipment and parking  has hit it‚Äôs all time lowest point and it appears to me that  this gym is being run into the ground. the only good thing about the gym is the space to train but there are now so many problems which have not been fixed or dealt with over the years that the issues can not be overlooked anymore.  when speaking to management about the issues it‚Äôs never ending excuses with issues not being fixed or dealt with properly.  it‚Äôs only going to get worse which is completely unacceptable with the amount of money they are making from memberships each month. despite the issues and members complaints they actually had the audacity to increase the gym membership 4 months to ago to help ‚Äútowards the gym maintenance‚Äù, no improvements have been made in this time and it‚Äôs got significantly worse. below is a small snapshot of the issues  .. ‚Ä¢the air conditioning in the gym has again stopped working as soon as the hot weather arrives, this is the third year in a row this has happened. the mangers that have come and gone in this time all make the same excuses and say they are working on it and air conditioning unit uses a smart system which isnt so smart! its unbearable to train with the heat, not pleasant breathing in everyone‚Äôs germs and body odours, sweating like your in a sauna and generally not a nice environment to be in. i felt like i was going to pass out the other day, at least last year they left all the doors open and they hired large portable aircon units. i‚Äôve had to start training at other gyms because of  this which i shouldn‚Äôt have to do when i‚Äôm paying for this membership. ‚Ä¢ the gym equipment is now old and tired and needs replacing ( like the new precor equipment they have down south) things are always broken with out of order signs on, most of  the cable machines are tired  and on there way out, dumbbells and olympic bars are mostly bent, some cardio machines are broken and need serious maintenance. a serious injury will occur, it‚Äôs just waiting to happen! ‚Ä¢cleaning facilities to wipe equipment down has been reduced  since january therefore equipment is not as clean as it should be. it might be the time of day i train but i personally have never seen a member of staff cleaning the equipment and also changing rooms have a disgusting smell constantly.‚Ä¢the gym did not notify members that 3 months ago there would be building work commencing in the apartments across the road and that the building company would be using upto 20 car park spaces and their builders allowed to park in it too. parking is difficult for members best of times and not enough spaces for the gym capacity before this. parking is at a premium and you cannot park in any of the surrounding streets as they are all double yellow lines. we don‚Äôt know when it will finish. on many occasions i and other members have had to train at other gyms when it is busy after 5pm because we can‚Äôt find a parking space. ‚Ä¢most  of the pt‚Äôs are  unfriendly and not welcoming unless you‚Äôre part of their ‚Äúclique‚Äù‚Ä¢the new assistant manager needs to address the issues raised by not only myself, but many other members too instead of parading around the gym gawping at myself and other male members.  i find it really uncomfortable and actually hypocritical given they promote ‚Äúa no harassment‚Äù  campaign on posters all over the gym. check the cctv, you can clearly see him checking individuals out. ‚Ä¢the gym is listed on a gay dating/meet up site which members can use the facilities late at night to get up to alsorts. its been highly rated aswell believe it or not.. madness! it‚Äôs not what we signed up to. the list is endless and no matter which manager takes over or managers from head office, none appear to be doing anything about it.unless something changes drastically, which i don‚Äôt think it will, there will be a mass exodus where members will leave and not come back. you shouldn‚Äôt be charged nearly ¬£30 a month to be train in substandard facilities where management don‚Äôt listen to or address any issues raised. if you are thinking of joining this gym, do yourself a favour and find another one.

Review Title: Please get a grip on your staff!!!
Review: i canceled my gym membership after a few months due to various reasons, primarily because of a staff member (edit: management at pure gym reported my review for identifying the staff member by name so i have omitted it from the review. however she has been mentioned in other reviews here and on google). she acts like she owns the gym, regularly forcing members, including myself, out of the weights section for her private class. she also records these classes for her social media which picks up other members in the background who probably don‚Äôt want to be in the video (i know i certainly don‚Äôt want to be an extra in the background of her boxercise vids). despite the availability of a private room, she insists on disrupting our workouts.  this is not the first time ive witnessed her rude behavior. when a member asked for help with a malfunctioning machine, she responded with a sour face as if she was being inconvenienced even though its her literal job.  additionally, she frequently shouts and uses foul language. other reviews also mention similar experiences with her. while the rest of the staff is friendly and the renovated womens section is great, the gym is often overcrowded, and my overall experience is consistently ruined by this staff member. considering the price increase and my dissatisfaction, i have decided to switch to thegym despite the longer journey.  edit: i‚Äôm not entirely sure why pure gym management have asked me to update my review. unless they have addressed the issue of the member who created a hostile environment, there is no reason for me to make any changes. simply stating that theres no tolerance for that behaviour make no difference to me or other members at the gymü•¥

Review: i just started this week. had zumba, bodyfit and dance so far. zumba was fine (ok types, i have done more active zumba at another gym in west hampstead). bodyfit was also ok but dance was just weird. first 15 mins we did 2 songs in good active dance movements and just as i was beginning to sweat and burn fat, the instructor started showing us some moves on the mat (like pilates or yoga) and she spent so much time trying to explain us the moves that my body completely cooled down. the rest of the 30 mins was just her showing us steps, we trying to learn and then doing it. but im sure i didnt burn a single calorie. it would be good to have a dance class which claims to burn over 250 cals do just that and not bother with teaching us some spiderman moves! also the smell of sweat is way too overpowering and general cleanliness is clearly lacking, but so many people have said the same thing in the reviews and if nothing has happened so far, maybe itll stay this way. my goal is to lose weight and gain some core strength so i will be continuing but not as happily as my experience with studio society at west hampstead.

Review: puregym‚Äôs class cancellation policy (cancel up to 4 hours before the class starts, 3 late cancellations within a month and you lose the right to book classes) is ableist and inaccessible. ironic as marketing is always putting out ‚Äòbe your authentic self‚Äô and ‚Äòour gyms are for everyone‚Äô messages.  some disabilities, parental and carer responsibilities, mental health conditions - and just if you had booked an early morning class and woke up feeling ill - are all reasons why the 4 hour window is too large and disproportionately affects groups that already face challenges.  speaking from a place of lived experience, i don‚Äôt think puregym is as inclusive as it brands itself as and i‚Äôd encourage it to look at its cancellation policy with someone who can advise on diversity, inclusion and equity.  puregym: you‚Äôre alienating a very large proportion of your customers and it adds insult to injury that your marketing messages don‚Äôt align. do better.

Review: visited castle marina gym in nottingham this is not my local gym but close and they have a great functional fitness area that is great for my hyrox training. i‚Äôd landed to do some specific training on the sled and track, so had positioned myself on one side of the track and started stretching off. there was a fitness class on at 5:30 which only had 6 people in it and the fitness instructor used one of the 2 sleds they have available and then as i went back to bag to retrieve my water bottle she took the other sled, i politely went over and said that i was just about to use it and was rudely shut down and informed the fitness class took all priority over everything else? the most annoying part was that both sleds had the same weight on and for half the workout only one sled was used, so i waited patiently and gave some feedback at the end. but as expected i got the same line about classes taking priority, they couldn‚Äôt grasp the fact that they could have still done their class using one sled therefore allowing me to workout using the other sled.

Review Title: Some major issues need to be addressed
Review: the gym is totally fine when not too busy (e.g. weekend afternoons or late mornings), but due to its proximity to schools/college, its often flooded with groups of teenagers who dont respect basic rules like putting the weights back or cleaning equipment after their use. the lack of hygiene of these young gym goers is something that should be addressed by the staff as well. also, they tend to be glued to certain machines without actually doing anything (they are just chatting, laughing and playing games on their phones). the worst issue however is that many of them are underage (some look 11-12) which is against the gyms own rules (please see membership t&cs) and they clearly shouldnt be in this space. the workers dont seem to be bothered with this issue, but this is a serious safeguarding problem and may also invalidate the business insurance in case any injury is caused to (or by) these kids. i hope this feedback is taken seriously and some real actions will be taken to observe the gyms own rules by its workers and prevent underage kids from joining/attending the gym.

Review Title: Disgusting male showers. I can't believe nobody has complained about this yet.
Review: this is a message i tried to send privately -via email, private message on social media, etc. but you dont make it easy: no contact emails, phones and use chatbots on social media. i had no luck getting to a real person so ill copy it all here.  hi, i have been wanting to write for a few weeks now regarding the state of the male showers in some of your gyms. i have been a member for over a decade and used to visit one or more of your gyms in edinburgh almost daily. to me these were exceptional, well priced and always clean.  well, after a long break during the pandemic years i have started training again -mostly in edinburgh west gym but also in the one in dunfermline, and have to say the state of the shower facilities is really something... i have thought many times about taking some photos or a video and posting it all to social media but i dont like to be the creep with a phone out in the changing rooms and prefer to give you the chance to rectify this.  just to make it clear, the male showers in edinburgh west are not being properly (or at all?) cleaned -they have orange stains (accumulated dirt) all over the place, shower drains that were partially blocked by fluff and stuff weeks ago still as they were. this is the case no matter what time (early morning, afternoon, late at night) i visit. every single time i find myself looking for a shower that would not instantly give me some kind of fungal bacteria by merely stepping onto it. yesterday it was mission impossible... honestly, most disgusting showers i have ever encounter! its not dirt of use, its dirt of not being cleaned.  this was my experience too a few months back in the dunfermline but admittedly i havent had to use them as much so cannot confirm if still the case -going there today, so ill update later.  the changing rooms and the gym floors are nice and clean, this message is only about the state of the showers.  i always recommended puregym to everybody: great gym network, good atmosphere, excellent pricing and, at the time, superb cleaning. what happened in the last few years?  i cannot be the first writing about this but regardless, i would really appreciate if you forward this message to someone who can act on it asap.  thanks.

on it.

Review: after joining puregym stratford when it opened, in january, my partner and i lasted less than four months at this establishment.  this is the most unhygienic gym we have visited; no wipe down stations, no paper towels, and embarrassing standards means equipment is greasy if not wet and wiping your hands on your own towel will literally leave marks after using any equipment.  the male changing rooms constantly smell like urine, and when gents enter the odour wafts out into the main floor. every time.  the management is incompetent. my partner and i eventually left after being physically threatened infront of a member of staff, who was less than enthused about dealing with the situation. after constant pressure to the ‚Äòsafe space‚Äô team, he then turned around his story and started blaming us. apparently, gyms are full of testosterone and hormones, and so it‚Äôs perfectly natural that people threaten to wait outside the premises to harm you. tattooed manager, please get a new line of work.  a separate but related note: i was initially amused by the inclusion of a ‚Äòsharps bin‚Äô in the gents toilets. on reflection, i‚Äôm sure this is a bennie that the crack and/or meat heads really appreciate.  i cannot stress enough: avoid this gym. absolute embarrassment of an establishment.

Review: pure gym lewisham, has its ups and downs, mostly down! i have been a member at this gym for a while. it was much better when it was run by fitness first, but then pure gym took it over. since then things just seem to go from bad to worse. if it wasnt for the personal trainers who are friendly and professional i would have left this gym a long time ago. the mens changing room and toilets tend to have an awful smell with leaks in the toilets on a regular basis. the hot water, as another member had pointed out, had been out of service for months. last year the bench in the changing room was not fixed down properly causing me injury and now just a few days ago my locker was broken into. all of my belongings were tipped out in the locker but nothing appeared to be missing, until i went shopping and noticed the cash i had in my wallet was gone. my cards were all still there but as a precaution i cancelled them just in case they had been skimmed. i reported it to staff who seemed to play it down and that a locker theft was rare and that it was the fault of a poor quality padlock. my padlock is of excellent quality!  i went to the police and reported the theft. the police said there wasnt much they could do but did state that thefts from this gym was quite regular and they have had a lot of members complaining to them. they said that pure gym needs to enforce their security but dont. when i went back in to the gym the next day i had to ask for a locker theft form, which i then completed. i was a bit surprised that this was not offered to me when i reported the theft to the staff that day. another member of staff then heard me talking about the break in and said not another one!  personally i dont think pure gym care as long as members keep paying membership. i now need to seriously think of finding another gym. just because this gym is convenient and close to my home is no longer a good excuse the remain a member here.
Generated Topics: i would recommend this gym to anyone who wants a cheap gym with no care for its members. if you are looking for a gym where you can trust

Review Title: Why does the website tell you to ring a number that just tells you to go to website???? I‚Äôve been trying to book an induction‚Ä¶
Review: i‚Äôve been trying to book an induction for nearly 2 months. i‚Äôve had email‚Äôs ignored, emails that sent me to the website, website said to ring a number to book induction, this has answering message saying they are an online gym there is no telephone service - so why put it on the website and emails???? (unless it‚Äôs to make money on the calls?). i‚Äôve been told to contact the gym manager (i have poor mobility) then i‚Äôm told to book on the website. yes! website tells me to book through the unmonitored telephone number. i‚Äôve been doing this for nearly two months and still not booked in. then i find today that the ¬£12.99 subscription goes up to ¬£23.99 after 6 months (i may not have had induction by then).didn‚Äôt notice that in the small print. i have to have been a few times before i next see my physio so he can see any changes. i go in two weeks time. i‚Äôm going to zip round today on my mobility scooter to see if i can get any better service. if not i‚Äôm cancelling!!!!!!  update! finally received an email and have in induction booked on 28th may. i have also been given two weeks off my next subscription fee. thank you, finally, after a very frustrating time, a result. still looking forward to going, not put off but it was very close.  update: i had my induction. very quick i can‚Äôt remember half of it. if i wanted more i have to book a ¬£45 personal trainer to help me plan my exercises. they were very friendly but more interested in how they would get me out of the building in an emergency. they also said i need to bring someone with me to assist me. my assistance dog wasn‚Äôt enough. i haven‚Äôt been able to find anyone so i have had to cancel my membership ‚òπÔ∏è

Review Title: A sheep dip would be cleaner than your showers ü§Æ‚ò†Ô∏èüò©
Review: ive been a member of this gym for about 2 years and ive noticed that the hygiene and cleanliness standards for the mens changing room have deteriorated somewhat, particularly the showers that have a dreadful stench to them. i think maybe the drains need clearing or changing.  if you scroll down at other reviews of this gym, there is a consistent complaint about the poor standards in the changing room, toiles and showers. the other thing that is pretty consistent is the robotic standard response saying that they take it into account yet changed nothing for over half a year.  it regularly stinks of weed in the changing rooms and in the stairwell.  furthermore ive noticed that theres a lot of chopping and changing of classes, primarily due to the high churn of pt staff. it makes it more difficult to get into and stick to a regular fitness routine with pts and classes you enjoy when the schedule is constantly changing. i think in the time ive been a member of this gym i need both hands to count the changes in management.  i like this gym, i like the team, although i know only a few of them now. i want it to do well, but i also think puregym hq needs to invest some time and money in helping them bring it back up to standard

week. weekends are quieter. a lot of under 18s now at the gym. some members are letting non gym members in the gym during unstaffed hours. a lot of people are breaking equipment or messing with equipment which can cause harm to others.  i myself have suffered a cut on my arm from a metal ring off a pin which was securely into the weights at 32kg which is not heavy and shouldnt of popped off. day trial to see how you feel.  this review is completely a honest review on my expierence at the gym.  may i add customer service via the main customer server team via messenger was very helpful when Review: i used a three day free trial at this gym to try it out as i wanted to join a gym. the first thing i noticed was that i could only go to the specific gym i had the pass for. i only noticed this once trying to gain access to the putney gym... but the code to enter didnt work. this wasnt a great start. the problem with these gyms being unstaffed is that you cant actually speak to anyone to resolve the issue and gain entry. you cant even phone them as they dont have a phone number. all you can do is email them and wait several hours for an answer, but why would you waste several hours waiting outside a gym for an answer to an email? very impractical  i then walked to the gym in wandsworth town which is the gym i had initially selected and fortunately gained access. i tried this gym out for three days and it also seemed like it was usually unstaffed. i at least managed to gain access and was able to exit the gym without much ado. although, needing a code to gain entrance and the gym being unstaffed didnt fill me with much confidence if the emergency services would need to gain immediate access due to needing a code to get in. if they did manage to get in by some quirk of fate, and needed to stretcher someone out then theres no way in a thousand years theyd be able to carry anyone out on a stretcher through those pods - even if they had a code.  i know they have their emergency leaver in case of an emergency, but they would still struggle to get in even if the emergency button worked properly.  from reading other reviews it seems like the emergency button has been used before and there was no help available.  for these reasons i would not recommend using this gym, even if it is somewhat cheaper than the competitors. the lower price comes at a higher risk!

Review: visited first week this gym opened, quite shocked. former bodybuilder/frequent gym user. i read how in a week the gym annoyed some people by not having trainers present to be helpful with pin access to get through the doors. well i got through myself, but no worker in site in the middle of the day to show me around, like changing rooms etc. then half hour later they eventually appeared.  look, the gym has lots of space for such a small gym, lots of power racks, lots of benches. yes typically there‚Äôs many young people in groups stood around taking up space whilst on their phones doing nothing. but, plenty of space for everyone. but, disappointed the gym lacks for calves, hamstrings and seriously lacks for back.  anyway, my issue was i put my bag down right near me on second floor (as couldn‚Äôt access these mystical changing rooms cause no one was around) and minutes later i noticed my bag had gone. i reported this to a young blonde female worker who clearly wasn‚Äôt listening or respecting what i was saying as i repeated myself multiple times. i said to her that i think a cleaner took the bag. her response was we don‚Äôt have cleaners today. she then asked what was in your bag, i told her clothing, gym stuff, nothing valuable but i want it back. she then said she thinks the cleaner took it. erm, she just lied by telling me there‚Äôs no cleaner today now it‚Äôs the cleaners fault.. hmm then she proceeded to walk straight to the bin at the back and pulled my bag out (as if by magic) then walked off and said it‚Äôs because i left it on the locker bench. what right near me? out the way? that‚Äôs not the point anyway you don‚Äôt take other peoples stuff and if you do put it in a safe place don‚Äôt stick it in the bin! and don‚Äôt lie to me about the cleaner. lol.  then, as she disappeared, i turned around and noticed the my drinks bottle i‚Äôd put down on the same bench just to take my bag back off her had also gone. the blonde gym worker was the only person who walked past it!  now this is a bottle and some clothing. but that‚Äôs not my problem here! utterly out of order. not only did i repeat myself, have to insist the bag is found because she wasn‚Äôt going to do anything, have her lie to me, see my bag stuffed in a bin, have no professional apology, but she wasn‚Äôt attentive and didn‚Äôt take ownership for the fact it was actually her that did those things. if that was your belongings how would you feel? lol. wow.  i watched on as a few more people struggled to get through the door and the workers were slow to react. (which puts people off don‚Äôt ya know)  i‚Äôll re review next time and expect a better approach and experience. and an apology! bet i don‚Äôt get one!

Review: one star ‚≠ê for the friendliness and professionalism of most of the staff. one star ‚≠ê for the classes i attend because those instructors are just brilliant. no star for the cleanliness of the entire gym, including changing rooms, toilets and showers. the only time the changing rooms are clean is around 10-11am on week days as i can see a cleaner working. no star for lacking the disinfectants and paper towels for wiping an equipment after workout. no star for the ac in the changing rooms not working as a heater during cold months or cold days. no star for resetting a shower temperature to cool (summer-warm) and reducing the time of running water to half of the time (approx.7sec before it turns itself off) since the british summer time in march despite there was no sign of warmer weather. i was told by the managers that they couldnt do anything about it as it is a puregym scheme trial in all gyms and that i can contact the company myself, but with no specific contact details provided. to me it looks more like saving on energy bills for obvious to all of us reasons! (im sure this shower temperature changes are not listed in the "terms and conditions"). i joined the gym shortly after it was newly open but if there will be no changes to my "no star" reasons in near future, i will reconsider to join somewhere else where i feel comfortable, cold free and my money is well spent for. what is the point to get fitter when my health is jeopardised by catching a frequent cold from using no warm showers, being surrounded by dust mites or catching germs from an undisinfected equipment. well, what wont kill you, will make you stronger would not quite apply here.

Review: this gym is 4 floors underground. i took advantage of the 3 day pass in january, (unfortunately they are not 24 hours so when i signed up just before midnight id already lost a day) i then signed up for another month cancelling after this as i found the atmosphere very weird and a number of staff seemed to be obsessed with my activities and whereabouts. i couldnt use my pin at the front entrance, which i think was done on purpose so i could give the staff something to do. it too weeks to rectify this, the tanoy system was sometimes put on very loud, which was quite offputting if you were "getting in the zone" music was controlled by staff seemingly so either on the treadmill or the mat. it is a very big gym, and with the membership price being the lowest on the market you really have to push through (being of a shyier nature) just to get past (some of)the staff. generally other gym goers are very respectful, keep themselves to themselves and the gym is big enough for there always to be a space for what you want to do, but i get the impression staff have to like you for you to be allowed to do what you want to do.  i then restarted my membership, for half the price, and no joining fee, and then paid for another month. for the last week i have been purchasing day passes until friday there was a leak and so it was a bit of a waste of money as the gym was closed because a massive section of the floor was completely flooded of sewage water into the female changing room and a section by the running machines. why this wasnt closed prior to 6pm or shortly after when id arrived i do not know - clearly it had not just started. i recieved an email at 10pm - 3 and a half hours after purchasing my day pass, 2 hours after being thrown out the gym, that it would work at other pure gyms unfortunately by 3pm the next day this feature was taken off.  the cleaner i met when i first joined was quite bolshy in the changing room, she was later hovering by the running machines, there are probably a few, generally the changing room toilets were always very dirty, i often saw toilet rolls were just left on the floor - whether you are a personal trainer of a cleaner, - i dont think they are cleaned regularly, but if you are working for an establishment at least take some pride in the facillities which are a)paying your wages b)being used by paying clients showers are clean but this is more from them not being used than anything else lots of the lockers in the female changing room are either broken, nearly broken or used without a lock, so when you are rushing and trying to find a space to put your stuff - good luck! i went into the mens on friday after arriving and the females being pretty much out of order, and they are far cleaner, bigger and of a general better condition. it is student led and i think the staff are comfortable with this. being from a dancing/fitness/performing back ground i really have to work hard in the gym and i also like to keep myself to myself i have found the staffs obsession with what i am doing both off putting and upsetting. there are 4 gyms in liverpool (puregyms) but as this is right in the centre by both liverpool lime street and central it is very easy to get to. i also kept initially getting my timings wrong, and instead of a member of staff just saying oh off peak is from 1.30, (i went at 1 one day) i really had to go into the app / website - the pods are tiny, its a struggle to fit in if you have a rucksack on your back, also if you are a bit claustrophobic but after being rejected access through the main door i got used to these pods- when my code actually worked. i think some staff have to remember they work for puregym, (and not the other way around) - unprofessional, uncooperative and lazy pts

dont know, but it seems like the staff are more obsessed with their own activities than the wellbeing of the members.

Review Title: Once you get in the gym and start using‚Ä¶
Review: once you get in the gym and start using the equipment, your frustration levels are easily settled (maybe due to physical exercises) and you can acknowledge that this gym (pure gym london borough) is a decent average gym. actually getting there (and literally into the gym) is a challenging but rather annoying hurdle one must overcome. this gym is often unstaffed, that means: no one at reception, no one answering your phone calls or messages. you cannot get basic information from the generic website. the lack of staff can make this an affordably cheap gym, but perhaps human support would be worth the extra penny. and bring a bloody lock for your locker as there is absolutely no information about this on their site. all in all, after my initial experience the good quality of the gym equipment is an undeniably strong plus.

Review Title: Pure Gym Wincheap is an increasing‚Ä¶
Review: pure gym wincheap is an increasing disappointment and i have been a member for several years. class timetable is virtually non existent, the equipment is tired and decidedly dirty, the environment is similarly unsanitary and the staff are basically in a rotating door. the new staff are virtual children and have little experience and no expertise in social skills, let alone teaching skills. this can mean that health and safety is an issue, as the necessary checks, demonstrations and correction of how to use equipment etc is not happening. the staff spend most of their time looking at their phones, even while running classes and virtually have no engagement with the customers at all. the model employed by pure gym does not work. as the instruction teams are quickly [mostly virtually] trained in a short time frame, thrown in to a site, they have no experience and little confidence, are desperate to get enough pt sessions [of which there are not enough to make it viable for most of them] and therefore they very quickly end up leaving. management is often poor and the sites are often neglected; dirty changing rooms, overflowing sanitary bins, lack of cleaning equipment, no toilet rolls ‚Ä¶ despite raising concerns over and over again and even meeting twice with regional management ‚Ä¶. it is the same old story. once kingsmead reopens in their updated and upgraded building .. i will be returning there. by the way, several other members [and exiting staff] share the same, if not more scathing views of both the system and the club. really a poor choice, if you are considering joining.

2. staff are bad 
3. management is bad

Review: i have been going to castle mall‚Äôs puregym since early 2020. the gym there is absolutely fantastic, excellent atmosphere, high-quality equipment and people.  as a very happy customer i decided to add a secondary gym to my subscription as the one in riverside is now closer to where i work.  unfortunately to my surprise all the machines (cables-pulleys) are of a different brand than the ones in castle mall. older, of lesser quality and with heavier weights. now, this isn‚Äôt the end of the world and i know that different brands have distinct mechanisms/angles/calibrations making them feel different. however, when i subscribe to another puregym i expect the same level of equipment and quality, not a downgrade.  this probably happens in a lot of other puregyms across the uk, and some people might not mind it, but for me it really throws off my routine and makes it hard to focus on improvement. what‚Äôs the point of paying for a +1 access when i have to change my whole workout schedule/weights as the machines feel like they belong to a complete different gym chain.  i think it would be beneficial if puregym could provide a more consistent experience across all its locations. that way, i can rely on the same weights and machines, and i can focus on improving my shape instead of wasting time trying to adapt to different equipment.  i honestly feel torn to write this dissatisfying review as i will happily remain a pure gym customer, however i will not visit again nor recommend the one in riverside over the one in castle mall. especially to someone like me who wants to use both/switch.

Review Title: Worst Puregym I've visited in MCR
Review: after 5 years as a puregym member, this is the third puregym im a member of and by miles the worst one. ive been here for a good few weeks and apart from in classes (that are ran on the middle of the floors as there are no studios), im yet to see a staff member. the gym and the equipment is outdated and doesnt allow for much flexibility or variation in your workouts. no kettlebells, no slam balls, no prowler sled, no room to do weighted walked lunges or barbell hip thrusts, no skiing machine and whoever planned the layout of this gym did not think it through at all. you cant bring weights around so if you want to do weights, youll be crammed into a tiny space downstairs where theres about 5 benches as theyve decided to cover the top floor with cardio equipment and make it lool like theyre still practicing social distancing - the use of space is that poorly planned. even if its cheaper than both market street and exchange quay which i have previously been a member of, its not good value for money like the other 2. market street feels smaller but its much better equipped and always has staff around. i went for this one as ive always been very happy at puregym but will now look elsewhere in stretford as this gym is so limited. i like to do my own circuit training and combine weights and cardio but its not possible here. its weights downstairs and cardio upstairs. very poorly planned with little innovation. its old school and doesnt have the best room for a fun workouts.

Review Title: Too many people on phones not working out taking up space
Review: pure gym is cheap and there are branches everywhere. this is the positive.the negative: having been to leeds, liverpool, twickenham, reading, and a few more there is one consistency: poor maintenance, and poor ventilation.  i am also fed up with people coming to the gym with a tripod to not work out but to flex on social media. this isnt policed, and the staff dont care. i do as its not legal to film without consent and when someone is pretending to lift, and filming me actually sweating, it gets on my nerves.  i have mentioned it to managers but they did not know that it is in fact illegal. pure gym, its time to educate staff, and kids who go to the gym to watch youtube on the bench should get a new hobby.

Review Title: Pure Gym puts members at Danger
Review: this evaluation arises from the observation that pure gym at bow wharf, and the company as a whole, prioritize profit over member safety. although i initially thought it was a good gym, on 16.04.23, a fellow member attacked me from behind without any provocation in the evening. fortunately, i was able to manage the situation, and nearby individuals performing islamic prayers heard my call for help and assisted in restraining the attacker. the police arrived shortly after and arrested the assailant, who was charged, but did not disclose his motives for the assault. i informed the gym of the incident, but they refused to cancel the attackers membership since it occurred outside the gyms front doors and because he is a member. i am concerned about the safety of other members since the gym has chosen not to inform them of the situation and is content to keep the attacker as a member, putting me in a difficult position. the following is my letter to them with legal obligations they need to fulfil which they are will to ignore.  dear pure gym bow wharf management,  re: pure gym puts members at danger - attacker mohammed baree  i am writing to express my deep concern and disappointment regarding your handling of the matter where a pure gym member carried out a violent attack on me outside the gym premises, but on the canal & river trust grounds. the attacker, the attacker, was charged under the criminal justice act 1988 and now has a criminal record for his assault on me.  it is utterly disgusting that pure gym is retaining this violent criminal as a member, placing all other gym members at risk. this is not the first instance where a gym member has carried out a violent attack, and yet, the gym has taken no action to prevent such incidents from occurring. i refer to similar cases where gyms have failed to take appropriate action to protect their members, and such incidents have resulted in serious injuries and even fatalities. it is unacceptable that pure gym bow wharf is putting its members at risk by allowing violent criminals to retain their memberships.  in the united kingdom, gym members have a legal right to safety while using gym facilities. gym owners have a duty of care to ensure the safety of their members and take reasonable steps to prevent any foreseeable harm.  under the occupiers liability act 1957, gym owners have a duty of care to ensure that the premises are reasonably safe for all visitors, including gym members. failure to take reasonable steps to prevent harm or injury can result in legal action against the gym.  in cases where a gym member carries out a violent attack on another member, gym owners have a legal obligation to take appropriate action to protect their members. failure to take appropriate action can be seen as a breach of the duty of care owed to members and may result in legal action.  there have been several similar cases in the uk where gyms have failed to take appropriate action to protect their members from violent attacks. in one such case, a gym member was stabbed to death by another member in a fitness class. the gym was held liable for the death of the member as they had failed to take reasonable steps to prevent the attack.  in another case, a gym member was attacked in the changing room by another member. the gym failed to take appropriate action, and the attacker was allowed to remain a member. the victim successfully sued the gym for failing to protect him from harm.  in cases where a gym member carries out a violent attack on another member, gym owners must take immediate action to ensure the safety of their members. this includes revoking the attackers membership and informing all members, tenants, and visitors of the incident and the steps being taken to ensure their safety.  in conclusion, gym owners have a legal obligation to ensure the safety of their members and take appropriate action to prevent any foreseeable harm. failure to take appropriate action can result in legal action against the gym and can have serious consequences for the safety of gym members.  furthermore, i will be taking this matter to the media as it is evident that the gym is more concerned with making money than ensuring the safety of its members. it is my hope that the media will highlight this issue, and the gym will be held accountable for its failure to take action to protect its members.  i urge you to take immediate action and revoke the attackers membership at the gym and all other pure gyms to ensure the safety of your members. i also request that you inform all members, tenants, and visitors of the incident and the steps being taken to ensure their safety.  *i am concerned about my friends and other gym goers and only by writing this review maybe pure gym will rethink about safety then profit.

Review Title: The gym is really well stocked with‚Ä¶
Review: the gym is really well stocked with equipment, clean and the staff are generally very friendly and polite. when it is actually open its a good gym. however, the gym is frequently closed due to a range of different issues. in the past month its been closed for two weeks due to drainage issues. other issues in the past twelve months which have resulted in closure or partial closure of certain parts of the gym range from no aircon, no lighting, no hotwater, drainage issues or the front doors not working. puregym offer use of other nearby gyms at these times, but st pauls for example is not equivalent in terms of equipment, cleanliness or towel service. building issues seem to take ages to resolve, which is becoming tedious the extra membership cost for this gym over others in the nearby area is really not value for money if you cant access what you are paying for.

Review: about 2 months ago, i arrived at the gym to find that the women‚Äôs toilets were all out of order which is a monthly occurrence here due to all the mentally impaired people who work out here - clogging it with their sanitary towels among other things. it was no surprise.  i went up to management, needing to go to the bathroom. they informed me that they would accompany me to the male toilets to which i replied ‚Äúi‚Äôd rather not as those will be filthy‚Äù. she reassured me that they had been cleaned ‚Äúthoroughly‚Äù by staff, ready for women to use. i followed her to the male toilets, waited by the cubicles (both were in use). someone came out,..walked past her and me without washing their hands. once again not surprising, simply disgusting. i went to the bathroom, came out after touching the door handle which has probably never ever been cleaned since this place opened and headed to the sink. pressed on the soap machine, and there was no soap. despite the manager confirming that it has all be sorted etc. i turn to her and say ‚Äúthere‚Äôs no soap‚Äù she then turns to a locker to see if there‚Äôs soap stored there. there is not. i‚Äôm standing there in shock and mind boggled - thinking ‚Äúwhen was the last time they even filled this up‚Äù. i would also like to mention this was at 5pm during rush hour. supplies should be doubled for that time. it was evident that she lied. the toilets were not clean, there was no soap and every single man who went into that bathroom could not wash their hands so they were just spreading their toilet infested hands all over the gym equipment. in addition to this, the antibacterial pumps are far and few between. 9/10 are empty whether that be at the entrance or down in the weights area.  i headed back to the women‚Äôs lockers to find out that people had forced their way into 2 out of the 3 toilets and tried flushing and flooded the whole bathroom. sewage just floating around. what a great start. bacteria not only on my hands but also in the air. what an absolute disgrace.  i‚Äôm not sure what is worse but having the manager lie to your face about the ‚Äúthorough‚Äù clean that was done is honestly pathetic.  if there is another pandemic,..i‚Äôm sure it‚Äôll spread nice and quickly here.  bring your own wipes, gel and soap cos they sure won‚Äôt have it here.

Review Title: Ok'ish, but could be SO much better with some effort
Review: classes run at this gym are generally demanding and well run by some excellent staff. however, the changing room facilities are nearly always lacking. the changing facilities for women are poorly maintained - shower number 3 (of 5)has been out of use to a poorly fitting glass door, for over 3 weeks causing delays from queuing. the one and only soap dispenser has been broken for 2 weeks and falls clear of the wall when use is attempted. when asked three days ago if this had been reported, a female cleaner replied yes but had no idea if/or when it may be mended. many days see the floors unclean with assorted rubbish and mess which gives a poor impression. there seems to be no "members internet" which makes individual training less attractive as tv etc cannot be viewed...(there are no screens on any machines, so no chance to watch anything at all, unlike many other gym groups. all-in-all, with some extra effort and attention by the pure gym group, broadstairs gym could be very good indeed, but at present it has to do better before i give a top score... hopefully, i will be able to do so soon

Review Title: Not what it says on the tin
Review: gym facilities are good but it‚Äôs a 24/7 hour gym sat in a 6am-10pm car park. for the average user that is probably no problem but i have a very busy life and need to go the gym from 5am. i have already been given a parking ticket and have had to chose between not going or going when it‚Äôs open. not only have i had to reschedule my whole day/ life around fitting in this time slot but it‚Äôs at the busiest time of day. i haven‚Äôt seen the live numbers below 113 people when i‚Äôve been in there which again adds time to my workout. the staff and equipment could be the best in the world but for placing it where it is completely takes away the one thing that stands the gym out from the rest. i do not feel i should have to find alternate parking and walk to a place i pay monthly for; it‚Äôs preposterous. there are no other gyms around that are convenient to use for me so until this is sorted out the gym in my opinion is completely useless. if you are going at more sociable hours then nothing in particular makes this gym stand out as being any better. it‚Äôs very busy all the time, sometimes hard to get the machines/ equipment you want without waiting, sometimes a substantial amount of time. better off supporting a local family run gym where complaints like this will be duly noted and taken into action. pure completely refuse to try and make any changes to the situation. currently reviewing the situation with the third party parking company

Review: the gym is great, as are the shop floor staff. but the company is morally bankrupt and only out to claw as much money from customers as possible. all over their website it talks about flexible packages, the ability to change as required. the reality is if you want to upgrade (give them more money) the process is simple. but downgrading is not possible without cancelling your direct debit (i have experienced this and a quick google tells me i‚Äôm not the only one). when you try downgrading on the website, they take you through a circle of web pages right back to where you started. when i contacted customer services i received a response of ‚Äúit‚Äôs easy to downgrade, click here‚Ä¶‚Äù taking me straight back to the circular process again. they caveat this message with ‚Äúif this process doesn‚Äôt work, you can cancel your direct debit‚Äù (you didn‚Äôt need to tell me, i have‚Ä¶). another really sad example of corporate greed trying to get one over on their (loyal) customers. frankly i have better things to do than mess around with cancelling direct debits only to then go through the whole sign up process again (with a setting up fee!), only for them to take advantage of me again.  update: following the response from puregym (below) i have copied in part of an email chain from customer services which demonstrates that they don‚Äôt easily downgrade memberships at customer requests, and they do recommend cancelling direct debits:  ‚Äúthank you for your message.  we are sorry you feel that we are "spouting lies" when informing you of our cancellation process.  also mentioned in the previous email is the information "if youre having issues this way its nothing to worry about, you can also cancel by ending your direct debit agreement with your bank"  this issue can be resolved by contacting your bank directly and cancelling the direct debit.  we are unable to cancel the membership on behalf of a member otherwise i would do so for you.  we are here to help and advise on the issues at hand as best as possible for our members.‚Äù  i‚Äôd be intrigued to hear more from puregym as to what has happened here‚Ä¶

Review Title: Your customer service process is a JOKE!
Review: why dont you guys have a phone line?  ill be honest the gyms are great, i love the gyms. my issue is the customer service operation. how can a company raise millions in funding but cannot afford a working phone line operation to help customers? i made a mistake whilst signing up yesterday, and wanted to change my email address. when i called the number i found online, i was told to email or dm using social media. it was annoying, but i needed help so i did it.  i then reach out via social media to be told somebody will be getting back to me in 12 hours. 12 hours? in 2023 it takes 12 hours to reply to a message? what the hell?  to my shock it is now almost 24 hours since ive messaged and ive received no reply. ive had to now do my own research to reach out to specific members of member services to get my query sorted.  there is no excuse to not have an active phone line. microsoft teams is there for a reason. ringcentral, zoom, anything. i work in an office for an online company and guess what? we have lines which people can reach us on. its not hard to do that. even if for some strange reason you dont want to speak to customers on the phone, an online chat function would work too. your customer service process is complete rubbish (i cant swear on here or else i would) and needs overhauling or else you will start to lose people.  24 hours and counting for a simple request? for a company of your size? in 2023? do better.

Review Title: The gym is full of underage people
Review: the gym is full of underage people. ive been a member of your westwood cross gym for around a week or 2 now and although i love the gym and the facilities, i have really thought about cancelling my membership and going elsewhere. the gym itself is great its just the number of underage kids youre allowing in the gym. i went with my nephew who is a 6th form student (17) and was pointing out so many kids who were below the age of 16 who attend his school. sometimes you go in there and its like a community centre for children just loitering around the machines. i have nothing against anyone who is genuinely trying to work out but you can see a lot of them are just there for somewhere to hang out.  in the changing rooms this evening there was a group of 4 or 5 just sitting in there smoking vapes. i had to get into an argument with them to move so i could access my locker.  ive seen them doubling up in the booth you have to enter to get inside the gym.  i watched 2 girls basically rounding round the gym screaming tonight almost like a playground.  i understand the gym is unstaffed at certain times but i feel like you need something in place so more regular checks are being made for this.

Review Title: What is going on with the Muswell Hill PureGym
Review: dear gym management, i regret to inform you that i have had a rather disappointing experience at your gym, and unfortunately, i cannot recommend it to others. despite my initial enthusiasm, i have found that your management seems to have little interest in addressing member inquiries or concerns, and your staff are treated poorly. i have observed several instances of abusive behaviour from your staff, which is unacceptable and unprofessional. in addition, the facilities seem to be neglected and not adequately maintained, with equipment often broken or in need of repair. as a paying member, i expect a certain level of customer service and attention to detail from the management of a gym, and i feel that this has been lacking in your establishment. i have attempted to bring these issues to your attention in the past, but unfortunately, it seems that my feedback has fallen on deaf ears. i hope that in the future, you will take steps to address these concerns and provide a more positive experience for your members. until then, i will be taking my business elsewhere. sincerely thomas

Review: felt the need to leave this review after complaints to the (very friendly) staff have all resulted in nothing being done - all the staff are aware of the issues and aware theyre problems but are also aware that theres no action being taken to resolve any of them.  the positives:  1) just had a refurb 2) the new kit is great (always having to hunt down plates though) 3) the new flooring and free weights are are also great 4) the staff are friendly, knowledgable and approachable  the negatives:  1) air con leaking (and has now for 2+ years) in the free weights area, despite this being an issue before the refurb nothing has been done about it  2) changing rooms arent locked.. ever  3) damaged / poorly maintained older equipment, older machines have been poorly maintained and some are borderline dangerous due to issues such as grips spinning when theyre meant to be rigid  4) repair times - equipment and facilities are frequently broken, repair times take anywhere from 1-2 weeks to 2+months a recent example would be the only disabled toilets/shower room which had no lock for approximately 2 weeks.  5)mens locker rooms: a) broken lockers - id estimate at least 30% of the lockers are unusable due to damaged locks or frames b) damaged and poorly repaired urinal - the urinal fell off the wall and hasnt been properly repaired, this is still leaking and has led to the changing room frequently smelling quite badly due to this. c) changed shower temperatures and timings recently, they are now barely warm with frequent blasts of cold water to encourage you not to use them. d) 2 evenings in the last month the entire toilet area has been completely flooded  ive been a member off and on since this gym opened and it has slowly gotten worse, i would recommend using a different site.  **update**  a month and a half on, nothing has changed, staff are still great but its obvious the owners arent interested in putting any money into fixing anything. would still advise using a different site  **update #2**  another month on, still nothing changed, more equipment broken awaiting repair, shower temps still low and swing wildly between cold and hot

Review: i‚Äôve been going semi regularly for the past three months, and the amount of things i see is unreal.  i‚Äôll start by saying the good points;  they are a 24 hr gym, which suits my schedule well.  they have free weights that are monitored to an extent.  there is an overflow car park which is free (even for the locals to dump there car in).  now for the bad;  there is no limit on memberships, causing the gym to be extremely busy. having to wait for equipment is normal in any gym but it‚Äôs unreal the amount of people sat on the machines doing nothing for 10 minutes or taking selfies.  the men‚Äôs locker room is too dirty, there needs to be a cleaner coming in halfway between shifts. after the night clean it‚Äôs great but just before that there is rubbish everywhere, bottles left out, urine on the floor etc. also, during the evenings the smell of weed is sickly. i‚Äôm not talking about a little bit either, it hits you as you enter the locker room.  lastly, i have had sixty pound taken out of my wallet which was in my pocket inside a locked locker! the padlock just left on the side, how they got in i have no idea, but be careful and use a key padlock and not a coded one.

Review Title: Used to be great. Needs an update, lacking in comparison to other gyms in the area.
Review: been going to this gym over 18 months and sadly, its going downhill. i dont know if theres a suggestion box, but know a few (especially female) members are feeling the same recently.  the weights area needs an update, especially in comparison to other puregyms and gyms in the area. theres two squat racks, one powerlifting platform, and two smith machines but understandably theyre very popular. theres only four 6ft barbells but they belong to the two squat racks, one powerlifting platform, and one bench press, so you feel bad stealing them. plates are hard to find and usually all over the place. the smith machines are ancient, they don‚Äôt even go all the way to the ground.  theres no hip thrust machine like other gyms or any space if you want to hip thrust or deadlift away from a squat rack. youd literally just be in the middle of the space and in the way. even if they invested in a hip thrust bench and barbell pad it would be better than nothing.  womens section has nothing in it but cardio and abductor machines. if the two spaces by the mirrors and two benches are taken, loads of women just have to workout in the middle of the room because theres a big ab mat holder in the only other decent space.  it has the potential to be an amazing gym but needs to be looked after a bit better, definitely falling behind. lately, there has been 50+ people in there from 7-10am, so gets quite busy which is great for peoples wellness but difficult for space. would be great if staff could consider updating equipment/layout.

Review Title: Removal of cleaning supplies but increase in membership fee...
Review: i am really disappointed at the removal of the cleaning station on the ground floor. only one paper towel dispenser has been left at the far end by the free weights. it is insufficient for everyone that uses the equipment on that level and shows no consideration for anyone using the cardio equipment. not to mention can be quite an assault course to grab a paper towel and get back to the other end whilst trying not to disturb, trip over or get hit by people in the middle of their own workouts (the folks using the free weights are by no means in the wrong). i imagine they are just as annoyed by having to watch out for the increased foot traffic.  having asked a few friends who use pure gyms elsewhere ive found this seems to be a hq directive which baffles me. yes covid is now much less of a concern but surely that should have proven how important cleanliness and hygiene is. removing right after announcing a price increase too, not a great look.  please rethink this. its so important to have the ability to clean equipment before and after use.  the gym itself is ok, during peak times there are queues for equipment but nothing i wouldnt expect elsewhere and the staff are very helpful. if i was rating just in those areas my rating would be much higher.

Review: i joined a puregym in london and i hired one of the pts. he was beyond unprofessional and situation got ugly. i reported him to puregym safe space team that claims that they have no tolerance to this. i also reported him to the branch manager. branch manager was super supportive but she realistically could not do anything about the situation apart from talking to the pt about his professionalism. safe space team takes days to respond and the entire issue just drags on way too long considering urgency of the issue. the pt was told off by his manager and now, to retaliate, he decided to fabricate his part of the story, and tried to justify him not delivering the last session nor refunding me, despite me flagging his breach in the contract he created and just decided to steal my money. he also deleted messages that could convict him from his wrong doing on whatsapp when i informed him i will seek a legal advice. he was extremely arrogant saying no one will investigate this and he won‚Äôt go to the court. he said that he was calm about the entire thing because he was messaging me in the presence of his manager at that moment which he deleted (although i saved that message). he is clearly a skilful manipulator and the fact he knows exactly what to say and which messages to delete makes me wonder if this is the first time he has done something like this. i am not quite sure what‚Äôs the point of the safe space team as they don‚Äôt seem to be taking this seriously. my money is forever lost and i feel that they just give a platform to a toxic man to do whatever he pleases saying he is self-employed and so they cannot do much. my horrendous experience which i have voiced is not dealt with with urgency and now i am questioning the genuine intention behind this ‚Äòno tolerance‚Äô that the gym promises. be careful!  update: puregym gave me a refund for my membership. they said they dealt with an issue but they said they cannot disclose how. now, i delivered an official letter to this individual with a standard procedure, requesting money back. if he disagrees, we need to go to the financial ombudsman.  this individual now said to me he will offer me half of the money he owes me, but if i still want to take it to the financial ombudsman, he will report me for sexual harassment. he also says that puregym advised him to take this course of action against me. this is especially interesting as they refunded me, apologised, and also said they cannot comment on the issue between pt and me because he is self-employed. now, they are advising him to accuse me and blackmail me so i am scared to take it to the ombudsman.  avoid this gym, this is the most misogynistic environment where they pretend they care by creating safespace clearly for an abuser they try to protect.

Review: this will be an interest read for anyone who has only seen pictures online etc and want a genuine understanding from someone who has been there multiple times. this gym lacks pretty much everything. the only strength i can give it is that it‚Äôs open 24 hours. firstly, it lacks machines which is fine if it were like most other puregyms and didn‚Äôt exceed 220+ people a day. it‚Äôs rather funny considering there‚Äôs about 3 stretching areas and massive, empty walkways for no apparent reason so there‚Äôs plenty of space to add machines. a lack of machines is one thing, but a lack of cable hooks is just embarrassing. honestly, you would laugh if you go there for the first time and realise there‚Äôs about 6 cable stacks/pull downs which are simultaneously without hooks, meaning the manager and co clearly didn‚Äôt pay enough attention to planning.  secondly, and more importantly, the clear lack of hygiene. someone else wrote a review concerning this and the response triggered me to also write one. trying to uphold a ‚Äúsustainability‚Äù record is not an excuse for not providing cleaning equipment like every other gym does. it doesn‚Äôt matter how good you claim your cleaning regiment is, it won‚Äôt fix the fact that 20 different people have used the same bench before me and none had access to cleaning tools‚Ä¶ i‚Äôll talk about the sinks later.  thirdly, the staff, particularly the manager, lack respect. good luck trying to enjoy a peaceful workout with her around. constantly threatening the entire gym for someone to own up to placing a dumbbell in an incorrect area or what-not. with all due respect, it‚Äôs a commercial gym. no one really cares where the dumbbells are placed as long as they‚Äôre re-racked, particularly during busy hours. maybe you could get angry at things like this when you fix the basic problems of your gym first like the sink design. the priorities are completely mis-prioritised. i‚Äôd be far more concerned with how poorly your sinks are designed that your hand is literally touching the floor of the sink whilst you‚Äôre washing (which yes, is the definition of counter-productive as you‚Äôre literally re touching everything which has been washed off‚Ä¶)  really bad gym, certainly the worst puregym in the radius. however, if you‚Äôre a casual who turns up to a class once a week and doesn‚Äôt really interact with any weightlifting equipment, go ahead.

Review Title: Alternative gym offer, not worth the email its written on
Review: i received an email from puregym banbury on thursday advising of "intermittent hot water in club." the email went on further to advise me that "you will have access to puregym bicester." so not having had any further advice from puregym banbury, i went along to puregym bicester. i found that my code didnt work on the doors but luckily, thanks to puregym bicester actually having staff available, i was let in, having showed the email to the staff member. props to him for that! i found puregym bicester to be better supplied with equipment. i completed my workout and left. i checked my phone and i found two emails from amy jubb of puregym banbury, with the message that my pin number doesnt allow access to puregym bicester. i then found a third email advising me that "routine maintenance has now been completed and hot water has been restored", signed by puregym banbury cross retail park. its a shame that puregym banbury had good intentions but failed to deliver on their offer. this comes down to staff not updating their customers on the current status of their gym. they update the door code but fail to update their customers. all of which makes their original offer of alternative gym use useless. i did give feedback already to puregym via the app, but have yet to receive a response. if i could rate puregym bicester separately id give them five stars.

Review Title: Unfinished and no excuses for such a poor state for a NEW Gym!
Review: clearly, puregym palmers was a rush job and opened not finished and is still stuck in that state...  how does this brand new spanking management head office approved gym fair months on?  -no wi-fi. there is zero signal inside so if you‚Äôre a parent that‚Äôs on call, or taking work break in the gym, or a local popping in you cant be called on an emergency. they did manage to get wifi for staff though, so there is no excuse not to chase for such a million-pound company with multi million network partnerships to send steve in to fix it asap. any internet service provider have an emergency sla to attend but their fails to be any chasing apart from i sent an email. i sent an email to my biceps but they didnt respond - work for it people!  mysteriously there is no engineer booking date and there isnt even an excuse for this. i have emailed the manager but she stopped responding. in the time puregym plamers green has been setup, i have setup 3 households with internet access to the same openreach provider as puregym and i dont have a high-power business account so whats the excuse puregym? this is fault of the higher powers at head office. this needs to be chased twice a day until there is a booking date but there is no responsibility. if there hasnt been chasing twice a day, fire the person who hasnt chased twice a day. if it has, fire the people who dont take responsibility to book. what an incompetency.  i managed to setup an internet connection. gladys did and shes an oap who has no idea what the internet even is, puregym is staffed and has how many departments? pull your finger out mate.  -some machines don‚Äôt have stickers to indicate how much weight you are lifting! after months? come on, put some tippex on the pulley machine. is there an excuse not printing your own stickers to show how much weight it being lifted? there is a print shop next door, literally! where is your budget of 50p to print some paper and get stickers for months? i tell you what, use the bio and the puregym advertisement leaflets to write numbers and stick them on the machine. if i were the manager i would do this and send it to head office demanding stickers next day.  -sweaty machines. ok, so the gym can‚Äôt force people to change their underwear or shower. if covid wasn‚Äôt enough, you can‚Äôt wipe the machines when an excrement-soiled person who hasn‚Äôt showered uses a machine, and you see sweat stains you have to touch and sit on and touch yuk!. trust me, in summer, where it‚Äôs worse, you will notice. already it smells due to the warm musky temperate - please dear lord above tell me the air con works but you can feel the bacteria and fungus growing due to no sanitary conditions whilst the inclusive radio announced once every 20 mins we at pure gym welcome use to use the cleaning stations and we are inclusive to everyone. well, there is a lie right there - management havent ordered cleaning stations and how can we count on inclusivity from the propaganda on the radio and the reality with our eyes?  -one wall is still chipboard and not painted. that‚Äôs how unfinished this gym is. its like working out inside those shed in b&q..oh! talking of b&q, there is one down the road. why not go and get some paint and do it up? you know what, that sickly colour makes my biceps shrivel away and shrink...leave it chipboard, at least i wont have to vomit onto my signals phone whilst the overly loud music and wretched heat makes me feel like im in a lucid nightmare.  -the music has risen considerably to an annoyingly loud level early in the morning playing the same one-dimensional genre. my wearable shows high noise levels if exposed. isnt this a health and safety issue? are people aware the same song repeats on loop again and again? its the most anti motivational trick but intended for 18 years olds. at least mornings until 4pm can you play somethign softer?  -the pec deck / rear fly machine handles are not an equal height. whoever assembled this wasnt much older than the pre-school who do amazing lego buildings across the road.. this isn‚Äôt just machine...this is both machines. is there a fix? i have an idea, hire that school kids to make it level. they will do a much better job that the team that left the gym unpainted, unconnected, no cleaning and setup the equipment that is failing and unequal.  -lastly, like other puregym, those signs of equipment out of order are starting to appear for weeeeks without any staff trained on how to tighten a machine. head office, let the gym staff do their job and give them a screwdriver or even a spare screw as its better than waiting 3 weeks for a repair company to travel from manchester to london to tighten a screw and have the machine out of order.
Generated Topics: make sure every single one of my staff knew the weight lifting capacity of their machines. this is a scandal and i will report it to the relevant

Review: for some reason, i dont see the london camden town gym on the list.  anyway, where do i start?  theres black mold in the showers. thats a health risk.  the toilets are often in terrible shape. recently, i came in on a tuesday and every single toilet was out of paper. how does that happen? seems like this wasnt checked upon for days.  more generally, lowering membership prices, dropping the joining fee, and offering "bring a friend" to the gym membership drives alienates your current members. why did i pay more for my monthly membership to have the gym crowded full of non paying people that overflow the facilities once every few months? where is the benefit for current members to put up with a weeks hassle and inconvenience of not having space to move in the locker room during a membership drive?  in short, the quality of cleanliness at pure gym camden has definitely declined since i have been a member. in addition to this, there is no benefit to me when you make incoming members pay less than i did to join. buy better marketing and market to a demographic that has the money to join and doesnt trash the place.

Review Title: would raise this with Gym staff but no‚Ä¶
Review: would raise this with gym staff but no one is ever around.  gym showers - male gym showers are either faulty, not working or cold. many of the showers dont have enough flow to give a shower, just a small tiny stream of water with lots of air. gym management are in denial that there is anything wrong with them, but enough members complain about them. 2 showers give an adequate shower but only on the small chance there is some hot water (shame they are all very dirty.... gym staff used to clean regularly by pouring cleaning solution around through out the day, this was removed since covid :s )  parking - parking continues to be an issue and has been for a number of years - but getting worse at the moment, gym management commit constantly to resolving the issues, but no action is ever taken - like many members have suggested, something as simple as noting reg numbers down and reviewing 4 hours later would stop people using it as their workplace parking. or get a parking eye or something, too many members cannot use the gym because of people using it for work, football or rugby parking - its becoming an insult to pure gym members that this has not been sorted after promising regularly.

Review Title: Filthy showers and changing areas, broken machines.

Review: i have been a puregym member since 2015 and always enjoyed my sessions at my local gym and never had any issues until recently when i just wanted to request changing my home gym and wanted to speak to somebody. i called the number which directed me to their email address. i then sent an email in which case i was given a standard automated response, so i emailed back to request a human response. 2 weeks on no one emailed me, i visited my home gym to speak to a manager but each time i went there was a notice saying that there was no manager onsite? i finally sent a message on facebook messenger to my home gym with my number requesting a callback from a manager or customer services and again 5 days on i have heard nothing!! i have been a paying member for 8 years and never stopped my direct debits although since covid i have been absent from the gym for 3years i still kept my membership going. all i wanted to do was change my home gym since there is another gym closer to me and i cannot access it until i speak to someone. in my opinion this is bad customer service and since i have worked in retail myself for 23 years i am shocked that this still happens in the digital world we live in. if this isnt resolved by the end of this month then im afraid i will be forced to cancel my membership with puregym and join the gym group or jd gyms which are also local to me now. i hope i dont have to do this and puregym can get in touch and keep me as their customer.

Review: the gym is an absolute mess! filthy gym , the machines look like they never get wiped down as every time i use a machine they are full of dust and grime. the floor around the machines looks like it never gets a hoover let alone a mop. my treadmill and step mill is always full of rubbish  full of  old paper towel and wrappers. one of the treadmills (the one on the left )stops working if you put the speed up high. the dumbbell area is very dirty, underneath each dumbbell is full of bits and dirt! ive seen other gyms use a steam cleaner on the dumbbell area or maybe just a wipe down would be ok. not enough machines for the volume of members. having one seated leg extension and one hamstring curl isnt good enough. the gym needs more cables as they are very busy and there isnt enough to go round. likewise having just one pec dec machine is ridiculous considering how busy the gym gets , need at least 2_3 of them. since i joined ive noticed a very bad smell near the handwash sink in the mens toilet, this smell is always there not sure if its a blockage or something. i only use this gym as its 2 mins from my daughters school and is handy after school run otherwise i wouldnt train there. before pure gym i trained at the gym group on kingsbury road and they are head and shoulders above pure gym in terms of cleanliness.

Review Title: Dont work for or at Pure gym...
Review: as an instructor at pure gym milton keynes winterhill, i find it appalling how i am being mistreated - being ignored when messaging or trying to contact both managers, no response. i have to chase them up literally to try get them to talk to me and sometimes they run off to the changing rooms or toilets to avoid me when i walk into the gym unexpectedly..  the managers cancelled my class with no reason, just because i tried to change the times of my classes due to other work duties that i have, i find this absolutey shocking and unprofessional as this defiantly wasnt my request!!!!!  i havent been properly getting paid for my classes since december, they owe me a lot of money and still not been paid for all my classes yet which i teach weekly..  im truly disgusted with this behavior and lack of professionalism at pure gym in how they take advantage of their freelancers...
